items.title: St. Joseph
items.summary: The Foster-Father of Jesus and Patron of the Universal Church.

items.title: St. Mark
items.summary: The Evangelist and author of the second Gospel.

items.title: St. Luke
items.summary: The 'Beloved Physician' and author of the third Gospel and Acts.

items.title: St. Paul
items.summary: The Apostle to the Gentiles and author of the many New Testament epistles.

items.title: St. Francis Xavier
items.summary: The great Jesuit missionary who brought the Gospel to Asia.

items.title: St. Gonsalo Garcia
items.summary: The first Indian-born saint and a martyr in Japan.

items.title: St. Anthony of Padua
items.summary: The 'Hammer of Heretics' and finder of lost things.

items.title: St. Teresa of Calcutta
items.summary: The 'Saint of the Gutters' who founded the Missionaries of Charity.

items.title: St. Alphonsa
items.summary: The first female saint of Indian origin, known for her suffering and holiness.

items.title: St. Padre Pio
items.summary: The stigmatic monk known for his deep prayer and spiritual gifts.

items.title: St. Mary Magdalene
items.summary: The 'Apostle to the Apostles' and first witness to the Resurrection.

items.title: St. Mary Faustina
items.summary: The Apostle of Divine Mercy and secretary of Jesus' message to the world.

items.title: St. Teresa of Child Jesus
items.summary: The 'Little Flower' of Lisieux and doctor of the Church.

items.title: St. Francis of Assisi
items.summary: The lover of poverty and nature who founded the Franciscan Order.

items.title: St. Clare
items.summary: The devoted follower of St. Francis and foundress of the Poor Clares.

items.title: St. Bernadette
items.summary: The visionary of Lourdes to whom the Immaculate Conception appeared.
